item.title: 8 Deadly Sins of Distributed Systems
item.description: There are 8 deadly sins ignored when designing and implementing distributed applications today. The network is reliable; Latency is zero; Bandwidth is infinite; The network is secure; Topology doesn’t change; There is one administrator; Transport cost is zero; The network is homogeneous. 1. Network is reliable Let’s be honest, the network is never reliable. And in most of the cases is the “scapegoat”. In your standup meetings or calls with production teams, its always network.
